subtitle: what do those white specks on your nails
mean what about the flaking skin you get
during winters are all these conditions
just random or are they actually signs
of something much more serious happening
in your body stay with us till the end
as we explore the reasons behind these
signs and tell you just why you need to
take them more seriously
brittle nails and hair might be caused
by a variety of disorders however the
most common reason is biotin deficiency
biotin or vitamin b7 is part of the
vitamin b complex and helps the body
convert food into energy
biotin deficiency is common in people
that regularly consume raw egg whites
since the protein avidin found in them
binds to the biotin and stops its
absorption into the body
biotin deficiency can also result in
fatigue muscle pain and cramps
to combat this you should try using
foods rich in biotin including egg yolks
fish meat dairy nuts and whole grains
if for some reason you can't use a diet
with these food groups you can also just
use a biotin supplement
normally a 30 mg dose per day should be
enough for most people you can also use
a shampoo containing biotin as its
active ingredient to get even better
results
chances are you've had to deal with
cracks on the side of your mouth
these cracks arise due to a deficiency
of riboflavin vitamin b2 vitamin b3 or
iron in your body
a deficiency of iron in your body can
also cause an increase in the occurrence
of mouth ulcers a study by the national
institute of health found that mouth
ulcers are twice as likely to appear in
people with an iron deficiency as
compared to people with healthy amounts
of iron in their body
another study found that around 28 of
patients with mouth ulcers had
deficiencies in thiamine vitamin b1
riboflavin vitamin b2 and paradoxine
vitamin b6
to improve the levels of iron in your
body you should take foods rich in iron
such as fish legumes dark leafy greens
nuts and most importantly beef liver
beef liver is a great source of both
iron and vitamin b
cracked skin and heals are common issues
during winters both these issues are
linked to the deficiency of the same
vitamin vitamin b
the b complex which is a group of b
vitamins is essential for the normal
working of the body while the body can't
produce it itself vitamin b is still
produced inside the body this is done
thanks to the bacterial flora in the gut
these helpful bacteria present in the
digestive system use vitamin d produced
by the skin in response to sunlight to
make vitamin b
since people rarely get a chance to sit
in the sun during the winters the amount
of vitamin d decreases resulting in both
a vitamin d and an eventual vitamin b
deficiency to improve your intake of
vitamin d you should start using cod
liver oil cod liver oil is rich in
vitamin d and vitamin a it's also a good
source of essential fatty acids
take a look at your nails notice any
white spots if you do then chances are
you're zinc deficient zinc has been
linked to nail growth and if its amount
in the body is lowered it results in
slow nail growth and fragile nails if
the deficiency is severe nail growth
might even stop completely
the way you can handle this is by taking
zinc supplements zinc is also important
when it comes to reproductive health so
i would recommend that you don't take
zinc deficiency lightly some studies
have also shown that zinc deficiency is
associated with poor glycemic control
meaning that a large amount of glucose
in your body can also lead to zinc
deficiency
try to limit your sugar intake and use
foods such as lobsters fortified cereals
and grains to up your zinc consumption
if you're craving ice then most likely
you've got anemia
anemia is a deficiency of iron in the
blood
iron is the central atom in the
hemoglobin protein which helps red blood
cells carry oxygen
when iron levels in the blood are low it
leads to a decrease in the amount of
oxygen your blood can transport to your
organs
you feel weak lethargic and nauseous
anemia is especially common in women
when they're menstruating since the loss
of blood results in iron being lost as
well
no definite reason is known as to why
people with anemia crave ice but a
recent study has shown that it might
have something to do with the fact that
eating ice triggers a response in the
brain that increases blood flow to it
this increased blood flow gives your
brain a sort of boost you should take
iron supplements to combat anemia both
synthetic iron supplements and beef
liver extracts work
leafy green vegetables apples beef liver
red meat and turkey are some of the best
sources of iron in your diet
according to the nih adult men and women
over 50 need eight milligrams of iron
per day and adult women younger than 50
need 18 milligrams each day
if you've got skin flaking off around
your nose or on your forehead chances
are you've got an omega-3 deficiency
omega-3 and omega-6 are essential fatty
acids used by the body to build cell
membranes and provide energy to tissues
a balance of the two is needed inside
the body to properly regulate their
individual functions
what usually happens however is that the
amount of omega-6 fatty acids goes up
and the amount of omega-3 fatty acid
goes down most americans consume almost
10 times more omega-6 than they consume
omega-3
omega-3 fatty acid helps to lower the
amount of inflammation in the body and
is super helpful for people with chronic
inflammation
lowering the amount of omega-6 in your
diet should fix the issue
try replacing nuts deep fried food and
chicken with cod liver oil sardines
seafood and pine nuts
yellow eyes are a classic symptom of
liver damage the liver is responsible
for the detoxification of harmful waste
and recycling of old red blood cells one
of the byproducts of the breakdown of
old red blood cells is bilirubin
normally this bilirubin is excreted out
of the body through the urine
however if the liver or gallbladder has
issues usually caused by a deficiency of
bile salts this bilirubin can get backed
up in the body and give your skin a pale
greenish yellow tint this condition can
then escalate into a jaundice attack so
you should address it as soon as
possible pure bile salt supplements are
a good option
you should also try and improve your
liquid intake so the bilirubin can be
excreted from your body as soon as
possible bleeding gums are caused by
vitamin c deficiency
vitamin c helps in the proper flow of
blood through the capillaries and if
it's not present in the required amount
this can lead to leakage of blood from
the capillaries
one of the main sites of this
superficial blood loss are gums and as a
result this is one of the best
indicators of low vitamin c in the body
the levels of vitamin c needed to cause
bleeding gums aren't enough to cause
scurvy but they are enough to cause
issues
treatment for vitamin c deficiency
includes eating more citrus fruits and
taking vitamin c supplements
some studies have found that an excess
of glucose in the body can lead to a
decrease in vitamin c absorption so i
would recommend that you reduce your
sugar intake too if you're suffering
from bleeding gums
lack of absorption is one of the main
reasons for malnutrition and excess
intake of sugar can lead to that
dandruff is caused by a deficiency of
vitamin b and zinc
both vitamin b2 also called riboflavin
and zinc play a crucial role when it
comes to maintaining the longevity of
your skin
when these nutrients are removed from a
person's diet the occurrence of dandruff
and other skin issues skyrockets
vitamin b3 or niacin is also essential
for proper hair growth
seafood fortified cereals leafy green
vegetables and nuts are great sources of
riboflavin and zinc make sure to include
all these food groups in your diet
